Name: Kingdom 18
Description:
Kingdom 18 is an 18 card hand management game with hints of deck building. Players take the role of nobles attempting to build kingdoms either through diplomacy or force. The goal is to grab the highest point value lands and create the most powerful kingdom or take less valuable lands that offer you powerful actions later.

Players start with a hand of 4 cards, each with 2 possible actions. These can be different values of military might or political savvy, or they can be an assassin or a shield that can steal the values of other cards their opponents play.

Each turn players place 1 card facedown on each land. These cards are revealed and another turn commences. After the second turn the players with the most strength on the land wins it. Bonus points are awarded for matching the types of cards the land prefers.

Collected lands count towards the end of the game scoring but also have their own in-game action. They are shuffled into the player's starting 4 cards and 4 new cards are drawn. The lands can have strong or weak abilities but only have one option.

Once all lands have been claimed the final scores are tallied and the highest score is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Itty Bitty Dungeon Delve
Description:
Itty Bitty Dungeon Delve is an 18 card tableau manipulation for 2 players. Each player represents a new adventurer exploring the cavernous rooms of a dungeon. Each is looking to gain experience and reach level 5 first, and they do so by rearranging the cards representing each individual cavern in the dungeon.

Players reveal cards from their cavern to rearrange facedown cards or gain knowledge of what the cards may be. At the end of the round they gain experience equal points from their cavern. If a player ends the turn with "The Smiter" card, they may instead choose another cavern to explore.

The first player to reach Level 5 wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Sengoku: The Warring States
Description:
Sengoku: The Warring States is an 18 card combat game. Players take the role of shoguns attempting to take out a rival with the use of their small army.

Over 3 phases players deploy 6 units to attack their opponents villages with the goal of destroying two villages, or the village containing their opponent's shogun. Doing so wins the player a battle. Soldiers remain facedown until the end of phase 3 or when an opposing soldier is placed down as well.

The first player to win two battles is victorious!

Contents:
18 Poker Cards
Folding Box/Rules

—description from the designer

Name: Ninja Bees
Description:
It turns out that competition for flowers and the pollen that they produce has become fierce. Regular bees can't tack it. Killer bees can'd do it either. Who can? Ninja bees!

Your Ninja Bee starts in a Hive and has to wage a stealthy path through charted territory to a flower and back safely to the Hive. But beware, for other bees are looking for the same flowers and are not above sabotaging your mission - in fact they relish the chance.

Ninja Bees is a competitive card game for two or three players.
It is mentally challenging (meaning it will hurt your head).
It may ruin all of your friendships.
Includes 46 cards play cards and 2 instruction cards, all 3.25" x 3.75" hexagonal and in a beautiful box.

—description from the designer

Name: Giant Ugly Flesh Monster Excavation Force
Description:
Giant Ugly Flesh Monster Excavation Force (GUFMEF) is a 2-4 player cooperative game where players harvest precious resources from the rotting corpse of a gigantic monster in order to fulfill contracts for corporate resources. Navigate the corpse, communicate as a team, and gather resources, but beware, this is a high-risk position! As time progresses, the corpse rots and the body of the creature becomes unstable. It becomes the duty of the force to make sure that they not only complete their job in a timely manner but help every person on the team makes it out alive; liabilities are not good for corporate!

With different monsters and different contract types, each play experience becomes its own series of trials; but hopefully, with the use of tools and wits, the force will have what it takes to excavate exactly what they need. Gravity and time are your biggest foes but that is just another work day for the Giant Ugly Flesh Monster Excavation Force.

Name: Fleurus 1794
Description:
La bataille de Fleurus (8 messidor an II) deals with the battle fought on 26th June 1794 between a french army under the command of Jean-Baptiste Jourdan and a Coalition army (Austrians, Dutch, Hanovrians and even a legion of french émigrés, that is royalists) under the command of Prince of Coburg.

La bataille de Fleurus is the 3rd battle of the series Les Soldats de la République.

The game includes an A2 map, a color player aid and 216 counters and markers.

Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).

—description from the designer
Families: Series: Les Soldats de la République (Vae Victis)

Name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Sanctum of Twilight: Expansion
Description:
Within the lavish rooms of the Silver Twilight Lodge, the most influential citizens of Arkham gather to forge business alliances, plan parades, and lobby politicians. In secret, they also meet to enact forbidden rituals with dark consequences. The poor souls who discover this truth often vanish, never to be seen again.

Sanctum of Twilight is an expansion for Mansions of Madness Second Edition that unites two new investigators against the Order of the Silver Twilight in two thrilling scenarios. With new spells, items, mechanics, and a new monster, this expansion immerses players in the Arkham Files universe as they confront the dangers threatening Arkham from within.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Atlantikwall
Description:
This new version of Atlantikwall has been redesigned and vastly expanded.

In addition to its 6 Battle Maps, including Omaha Beach II & Exercise: Fabius, Atlantikwall contains 3 “mini-expansions” that are completely independent from each other. Players can add 1, or 2, or all of them to their game:

Atlantikwall: This module lets one player play the German side on any existing Battle Map. The German player can transform a 2-player game into a head-to-head confrontation, or be added to any group of players (even solo). Includes a full set of unique German Specialists, German Items and Decorations, a set of Red, White & Black dice, a player aid, a Resource card, and some additional Allied Specialists and Items.

Think of the German player as the Battle Map itself. It is up to him or her to “activate” some of the features of the Map, and to make life difficult for the Allies. He plays like all the other players, rolling dice to gather resources, and spending those resources to recruit Specialists and find Items. The main difference is that the German does not move: instead, he uses his Courage to draw cards from the "Decorations" deck, which give him special one-time abilities.

Battle Conditions: This deck of 50 cards reflects the unpredictability of battlefield conditions, whether it’s from nature itself or the hazards of combat. Drawn at the start of each turn, they affect all players and supersede Sector attributes, offering a variety of effects like friendly fire or smoke cover. Some are good, some are bad, and some offer opportunities to be seized at the right moment. Beware of plane crashes, supply trucks catching fire or loss of morale!

Badges: A reprint of the 1st edition hard-to-find mini-expansion, consisting of 10 cards. Badges can be drawn at random by a Unit that obtains a "Battle Cry" RWB. They have a one-time effect (much like Items), usually helping their Unit obtain RWB bonuses or Awards more easily.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Quardo
Description:
QUARDO is an exciting strategy game that challenges your planning, analytical, and pattern recognition abilities. In the “Touch of Quardo” advance game, the sense of touch, spatial coordination, and memorization skills are added to test players' spatial intelligence.

The objective of Quardo is to form multiple squares or lines of four pawns with a common attribute and to collect the associated tokens/coins. The player with the most number of tokens/coins wins.

With the addition of blindfolds for covering the eyes of ordinary players, Quardo is also designed to accommodate blind or vision-impaired players. Appoint an observer to administer the game if necessary.

—description from the designer

Name: DropMix: Pop Playlist Pack (Flawless)
Description: The Pop Flawless playlist comes with 15 DropMix cards plus 1 hidden track card. This playlist features music from: Fifth Harmony, Outkast, Danny Humbles, Blanks, Meghan Trainor  and more. This Playlist Pack is exclusively sold at Target stores.

Name: DropMix: Hip Hop Playlist Pack (Bomb)
Description: The Toys "R" Us exclusive Hip-Hop "Bomb" playlist comes with 15 DropMix cards plus 1 hidden track card. This playlist includes music from: Anderson Paak, Bach, The Black Eyed Peas, Joliet, Salt-N-Pepa, Skrewbert, Technotronic, Victoria Chance, and The Weeknd.

Name: Fuel & Duel
Description:
This is a light weight racing game for the light hearted. Racing around the track trying to get first over the finishing line as you are pumping up the steam in your engine and knocking out the others out of the way. But be aware that you will lose if you run out of fuel.

A kids and family racing game introducing resource management for younger players. Fuel the car engine to move, the more you feed the engine the faster it could go, but as hotter it gets.

Manage your resources and roll to move.

Bild your own racing tracks with the modular boards, customise your vehicles, manage the resources, nock the other cars out of track or try to break them and win the game.

Slogan: Racing for glory, win with luck and planing.

Theme: Car race

How to win: First to move over the finishing line of the final lap is the winner of the game.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: San Andreas Fault
Description:
In this Age of Steam expansion, In this expansion, yellow cubes represent gold, and red cubes represent medical supplies. Denver demands gold at the beginning of the game, but demand for medical supplies is only created by earthquakes.

The map features two tectonic plates, divided by a wide red zigzag, which represents the San Andreas Fault.

—description from the publisher

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Hawaiian Islands
Description:
This new Age of Steam expansion is a solo puzzle!
Each island represent a city and link is represented by connections between the islands.
The aim of the game is to clean the cubes on the link when you pass through the link...

—description from the publisher

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Congo/Sweden
Description:
This is a pair of two maps :

     In the Democratic Republic of Congo, more than half of the gross domestic product is derived from the agricultural sector, and fire is a major component, as it is in most of Africa. Fire is often used to burn forests and other natural vegetation to clear the way for new farmlands.


In this scenario, the fire has gotten terribly out of hand, slowly enveloping the country in flames. A very challenging scenario for any railway tycoon attempting to fire up business there.


     Sweden: In this map, goods are continuously recycled into other goods until they have cycled all the way to garbage which is fed into incinerators. A timely WTE Plant Operator action can score bonus points for the player that can catch the plant full of garbage!


—description from the publisher

Name: Fugo
Description:
Fugo is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board).

				
				
					DefinitionsA group is a stone along with all stones one can reach from it through a series of steps onto orthogonally adjacent stones of its color.

A liberty of a group is an empty point orthogonally adjacent to it.

A smothered group is a group without liberties.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. At the start of your turn, you will face one of these situations:


     There are no smothered friendly groups. In this case, you must place a stone of your color on an empty point. Your placement must not increase the number of smothered friendly groups unless it also increases the number of smothered enemy groups.



     There are one or more smothered friendly groups. In this case, you must move one stone from one of those groups to an empty point such that, after the move, the group that now includes the moved stone has at least one liberty. You may only move a stone from a point where it is orthogonally adjacent to one or more enemy stones.


If you have no moves available on your turn, you lose. Draws are not possible.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Norman Withers Promo Cards
Description: This is a set of four cards to add Norman Withers to Arkham Horror: The Card Game. They were included with copies of the novella Ire of the Void.
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – Books & Replacement Cards
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Fireteam Zero: Recon Event Pack
Description:
Add 30 all new event cards to your games! Keep your squad guessing with these dangerous and delightful arcane happenings. Compatible with all sets and add-ons!

—description from the publisher

Name: Fireteam Zero: Operation Harbinger
Description:
Play an all new multi-mission Operation!

Forward observer base Gecko near Tobruk is reporting sightings of watchers just outside their perimeter. Army intelligence is discounting the reports due to the insistence of the men that the watchers are "devils" and chalking the reports up to battle stress.

Despite being unable to match the descriptions to known entities, Division Zero HQ is convinced that something is very wrong at Gecko. Survive 3 new Acts in Operation Harbinger and discover the fate of Forward Base Gecko.

—description from the publisher

Name: BuzzPutt
Description:
BuzzPutt is a 1-4 player golf game that has you playing adorable bees! There are three pre-made putt putt courses that you and your friends can play on. Each person will select a bee and its matching ball. You have to place the ball on the starting point of the board, with the arrow pointing towards where you want to move.

Then, you roll the dice and pick a shot (basically a stroke in golf) based on what you have rolled. You can now move your ball that far. If you land on certain tiles, such as the honeycomb tiles, it'll cost you more movement points to move out. If you end up out of bounds, you must end your turn and start your next turn on the last tile you touched. Once everyone is at the end, you can move onto the next course.

—description from the designer

Name: Pusher Kings
Description:
Pusher Kings is a funny, two-player card game that has you struggling to maintain control of the drug market in your town! This game is not a deck builder, so both players will be playing from a pre-set deck. Each player gets a hand of seven cards (with at least one "pusher" card in their hand) before the game starts. You must flip cards to use them, only using specific cards for your turn.

There are a few different card types; Pushers, Henchmen, and Actions. Pushers sell the drugs and can be used once per turn. Once you flip the card over in order to use them you gain money that can only be spent during that turn. Once the turn is over, the money disappears. Pushers cannot attack, defend, or take damage and only one can be used per turn.

Henchman have different costs, abilities, and attributes. They are used to gain power in the town and can be attacked. Henchman also cost a fair amount of money each, so you will need to be able to pay them to use them in your turn. The first turn you draw a henchman, you have to have them flipped, so they cannot be played right away.

Action cards are not flipped but instead discarded. There are only two of each action card in the deck, so you need to play them wisely. Each action is immediate and costs resources to play. These can be used to harm player’s henchmen or the player themselves.

Each player has 10 health points (the player themselves who holds the cards) so once they have been harmed enough to reach zero health points, the game is over.

Pusher Kings has some really awesome artwork drawn on the cards! This card game does not have deck building aspects, so it is an easy game to pick up and play with your friends.

—description from the designer

Name: House Rules
Description:
House Rules is a print and play party game where you make the rules!Take turns racing around the board, drawing cards with rules on them and collecting Star Tokens. One turn you might get a Board Rule that advances you three spaces. On your next you might get a Player Rule telling you to:


        Win a 10 second round of Charades or return to your last space
        Tweet to your secret crush or lose a Star Token
        Sketch a player in under 30 seconds AND get their approval
        Break into teams of two, have one player pick a secret word and get the other to answer it - the first team to guess their word wins Star Tokens


Everything you need to play is included in the download. Just print and play!

—description from the designer

Name: Freight Wars
Description:
Freight Wars is a 2-3 player game where you can procedurally generate your game tiles before you print them, giving you a completely unique game set. You are a Victorian industrialist who is looking to build a transportation network. You can do this by placing roads, rivers, or railways to connect towns to other places, as well as block off the routes of your opponents.

First, you must choose which mode of transportation each player should use. One should use roads, one rivers, the other should use trains. Then, you must shuffle the cards and hand them out to various players. Each player should get a town card, as well as two other cards dealt to them.

Players must place tiles so that the modes of transportation connect to the tiles already placed on the table. These tiles will need to match up for every mode of transportation to be placed, then the player will be able to draw another tile from the deck, so they always have three cards. Players can also skip a turn by discarding all of their tiles to draw a new hand.

After all of the tiles are placed, players must count up how many connections they have between towns. There are different points depending on how well the transport links are between different places. This can be seen in more detail in the rules of the game.
—description from the designer

This print-and-play game has an unusual distribution method - players download a Windows executable program which generates random tiles for printing.  Once printed, the tiles are used for traditional tabletop play.  Because the tiles are programmatically generated with randomization, no two sets will be exactly the same.

—user summary

Name: Meat Sweats: The Game
Description:
Friends gather to grill and eat massive quantities of meat at a backyard barbecue, but there’s not enough space on the grill!

This card game features simultaneous action, variable player powers, hand-management, take-that and a towel to avoid the dreaded Meat Sweats.

The first player to eat 7 pieces of meat ends the game, but the player that consumed the highest combination of quantity and quality meat wins (most points).

Each round, grill cards are spread out in the center of the table to represent meat on the grill. These cards also have a hidden value on the back of the card based on the quality of the meat (for end game scoring).

Players simultaneously position their characters next to a grill card that they will attempt to eat.  Players then simultaneously play a meat craving card (face down) from their hand and reveal.  If players have a matching meat they can score it, unless someone else wants the same meat and is willing to pay more matching cards for it. No one scores ties, unless you or a temporary ally play a Meat Sweats card on your opponent. If you receive the meat sweats card, you're unable to claim meat this round, but you get to keep the meat sweats card, making you more powerful later on!

—description from the publisher

Name: FC Kip Feestspel
Description:
A simple cardgame based on a Dutch comedy series.

Players have to match numbers or colors to the discard pile. The first to have an empty hand wins the game. Some cards instruct players to take more cards or skip turns.

—user summary

Name: mei-mei-tantei
Description: åè¬ŽåµæŽ¢ (Mystery Detective) is a fast-paced competitive logical deduction game for 3-8 players.  A suspect, a motive, a weapon, and a location are chosen at random from a deck of cards, then players take turns interrogating each other for information about each of the aspects of the crime (by taking a card of the chosen type from another detective).  When one player thinks they have the solution, they compare their answer with the hidden cards.  If they are correct, they win!  However, if any part of their answer is incorrect, the game continues and the foolish detective is eliminated.

Name: Pocket Skirmish
Description:
Pocket Skirmish is a fast-paced tactical card game for 2 players, in which you assume control over 3 units on a randomly generated map. With tactics and luck, you achieve victory by defeating all of your opponent's units!

—description from the publisher

Name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Ninjas of Iga
Description:
Hiding in the shadows, creeping in the corner of your eyes, the Ninja of Iga have selected you as their next target...

Masters of stealth, ninjitsu, both hand to hand and weapon combat, the ninja is an unprecedented threat on the battlefield, even a skilled samurai has to be cautious when fighting against a ninja!

Armed with ninjato, kamas, sais, throwing knives, tekko-kagi, even shuriken and a grappling hook, they use a variety of tools to overwhelm their opponents. Keeping their armour minimal, the ninja highly prioritises sheer offensive force to defeat their enemy.

—description from the publisher

Name: ゲット★スイートラブ (Get★Sweet Love)
Description:
User summary
ã‚²ãƒƒãƒˆâ˜…ã‚¹ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ– (Getâ˜…Sweet Love) is a Japanese card game of match-making, but with somewhat adult themes and language.

In the game, players are dealt hand cards and draw and play more cards through the game. There are four female character cards dealt face up on the table, and the players are girl-chasers, competing to win the 'best' one. But which woman is best is only determined at the finish.

During the game, players play hand cards against their chosen targets. These attribute cards have positive values for virtues, and negative values for bad behaviour. Some cards are played face-up, some face-down, so there is a strong element of bluffing in the game. Some attribute cards alter the rules as they are played.

The game is very social and encourages table talk about the good or bad attributes. For example, during game play, players will talk up the virtues of one girl, and talk down the vices of another. "She is Born Rich! That's 6 points! I'm after her." "But she's also a Money-Waster. -8 points. Are you sure you want her? hehehe."
"You know what? This girl is so Gentle and Kind and worth 8 points!" "Poor you. You might have not known, but actually, she is a B*tch. -6 points!" "Oh no, she's a B*tch and also likes Kinky Sex? Oh my oh my..."

Players also put secret tokens on the female cards, to show their likes or dislikes. After the cards have been played, the players must 'Express Love' by simultaneously pointing at the woman they chose. If only player chooses one woman, they get her. If more than player points at one woman, the player with the highest token wins her.

Then all the attribute cards are flipped and the value of the different women is calculated. The player who picked the best woman, wins!

There are two Versions of the game, this original edition is themed on men trying to get the best girlfriend. There is another edition with the genders swapped, and the women are trying to get the best boyfriend - ã‚²ãƒƒãƒˆâ˜…ã‚¹ãƒžãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ– (Getâ˜…Smart Love). Whilst the games are very similar, there are differences in the special cards which affect the gameplay. With both editions, you can combine and play an 8 player game.

The game name has a couple of twists. The English name can be abbreviated to Geâ˜…S Love, which for Japanese readers equates to 'guess love', trying to guess which girl to choose. But the name ã‚²ã‚¹ãƒ©ãƒ– in Japanese, has the word ã‚²ã‚¹ in it, which is used in many vulgar or even obscene words in Japanese. So the publisher is deliberately signalling to buyers that the game is for adults but still sociable, since the girl-chasers will be nice to some girls, and not so nice to others. This version has gone through ten reprints in Japan and always draws a crowd at game shows, with its risque design (by Japanese standards).

Publisher's summary

Getâ˜…Smart Loveã¨æ··ãœã¦1åï½ž8åã§éŠã¶äº‹ã‚‚å¯èƒ½ã€‚

Name: Auto Rennen
Description:
The players have to drive their racing cars from start to finish. Movement is determined by a standard die (1-6) and a color die. The result of the color die decides which car is to be moved. So each player rolls for all players in the game. On illustrated spaces, events hinder or benefit the player. The first player to reach space 76 wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Ruck Zuck
Description:
The players have to move their token from start to finish. The token have holes in their center, which are used to move the token with a stick (lance). Movement is determined by 40 small cards with letters on them. The cards are used to form the words "Ruck" and "Zuck". The players start with 3 cards, lying open in front of them. Every turn the player draws a card. As soon as he can form one of the two words the player has to move his token accordingly. "Ruck" means forward and "Zuck" means backward. The number of spaces is equal to the number of cards used to form the word (2-4). If a player moves his token onto a green space, he may move forward to the next green space. A red space means the player has to move backward to the last red space.
The first player to reach the finish wins the game.

Name: Kill the Unicorns: The Underground Awakens
Description:
Expand the Queendom with The Underground Awakens Expansion!

This expansion includes:
22 New Unicorn Cards
2 New Characters
16 Hunt Cards
16 Scheme Cards

Name: Building A Better Monster
Description:
Building a Better Monster pits players against each other as Mad Scientists competing to be the first to build a unique creature and bring it to life. When not acting as the Mad Scientist, you take on the role of Angry Villagers trying to work together to stop the current Mad Scientist's work.

The game plays using one standard 6-sided die to determine what twisted blueprints they’ve jotted down from fever-dreams and insane visions, as well as 6 custom Mad Scientist dice to determine what building blocks they’ve managed to collect from local cemeteries, mortuaries, hospitals, or prisons. Each scientist uses these materials to make their twisted schematics a reality. With the help of their faithful lab assistants and the occasional pack of ghouls at their summons, the madness is contagious. The Angry Villagers have their own set of 6 custom dice to determine their actions for the night. Will they storm the lab with a Pitchfork or Fire? Will they decide to cut off the Electricity instead? Maybe some will sleep through the night or decide to go Grave Robbing instead to use for their own creations.

—description from the publisher

Name: Paolo Tortellini
Description:
In Paolo Tortellini players collect sets of foods to win. Each player is dealt 5 cards and draws one additional one each round, trying to get two sets of three cards each.

Essentially, it's a children's version of Rommé where you have to collect two sets of three cards each out of 8 sets of 4 cards.

Name: Kagami
Description: Kagami is a one to four player solo or cooperative abstract game in which players attempt to mirror two sides of an eight by eight board or four quadrants for a more challenging experience and more players. The game is played without verbal communication. Players score based on the type and number of stones perfectly matched on the board.

Name: ゲット★スマートラブ (Get★Smart Love)
Description:
User summary
ã‚²ãƒƒãƒˆâ˜…ã‚¹ãƒžãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ– (Getâ˜…Smart Love) is a Japanese card game of match-making, but with somewhat adult themes and language.

In the game, players are dealt hand cards and draw and play more cards through the game. There are four male character cards dealt face up on the table, and the players are boy-chasers, competing to win the 'best' one. But which man is best is only determined at the finish.

During the game, players play hand cards against their chosen targets. These attribute cards have positive values for virtues, and negative values for bad behaviour. Some cards are played face-up, some face-down, so there is a strong element of bluffing in the game. Some attribute cards alter the rules as they are played.

The game is very social and encourages table talk about the good or bad attributes.

Players also put secret tokens on the male cards, to show their likes or dislikes. After the cards have been played, the players must 'Express Love' by simultaneously pointing at the man they chose. If only player chooses one man, they get him. If more than player points at one man, the player with the highest token wins him.

Then all the attribute cards are flipped and the value of the different men is calculated. The player who picked the best man, wins!

There are two Versions of the game, this second edition is themed on women trying to get the best boyfriend. There is another edition with the genders swapped, and the men are trying to get the best girlfriend - ã‚²ãƒƒãƒˆâ˜…ã‚¹ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ– (Getâ˜…Sweet Love). Whilst the games are very similar, there are differences in the special cards which affect the gameplay. With both editions, you can combine and play an 8 player game.

The game name has a couple of twists. The English name can be abbreviated to Geâ˜…S Love, which for Japanese readers equates to 'guess love', trying to guess which girl to choose. But the name ã‚²ã‚¹ãƒ©ãƒ– in Japanese, has the word ã‚²ã‚¹ in it, which is used in many vulgar or even obscene words in Japanese. So the publisher is deliberately signalling to buyers that the game is for adults but still sociable, since the girl-chasers will be nice to some girls, and not so nice to others. This version has gone through five reprints in Japan and always draws a crowd at game shows, with its risque design (by Japanese standards).

Publisher's summary

é€šç§°ã‚²ã‚¹ãƒ©ãƒ–ï¼ˆGuess Loveï¼‰

Getâ˜…Sweet Loveã¨æ··ãœã¦1åï½ž8åã§éŠã¶äº‹ã‚‚å¯èƒ½ã€‚

Name: クエストREクエスト (Quest Re quest)
Snowbirds: Storms
Description:
The Storms mini-expansion adds new weather event cards for Snowbirds' Action deck, a collection of both storms and good weather to increase the game's challenge. These 9 cards offer trade-offs that modify the route, easing some aspects while complicating others. Players must work to play them effectively, maximizing benefits without succumbing to the dangers. It’s a risk/reward gamble that can boost your score or ground your flock early. Can your flock handle it?

—description from the publisher

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Prognosticating Punch
Description:
One of three cards for The Red Dragon Inn: 2016 SlugCrew Minor Reward. This card was given away if you have registered in SlugCrew and have done their events.

This drink allows you to look at any player's "Drink Me!" Pile and put it back in any order.

A second edition of this card is part of the The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox (Collector's Edition).

Name: The Pursuit of Happiness: KS Promos 2
Description:
A bundle of mini-expansions and extra cards that were available during the Kickstarter for The Pursuit of Happiness: Community. A wooden Palm Tree first player marker was also included.

Friends Cards (10): A mini-expansion, Friend cards are placed between players and provide an action with potential end game bonus for one of the two players on each side of the card.

Ongoing Life Goals (3): Life goals checked at the end of each adult round.

Pets (8): Pets are special Item - Activity cards and can be combined with the 10 Pets from the base game KS Promos.

Stand-Alone Jobs (3): Consists of 3 new jobs that are shuffled in with the standard job cards and can be combined with the 3 Stand-Alone Jobs from the base game KS Promos.

There were also bonus cards of the following types:
Child Trait (2), Item - Activity (10), Partners (3), Projects (9).

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Golden Stout
Description:
One of three cards for The Red Dragon Inn: 2016 SlugCrew Minor Reward. This card was given away if you have registered in SlugCrew and have done their events.

This drink forces you to pay 1 gold to the inn.

A second edition of this card is part of the The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox (Collector's Edition).

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Timewarp Tonic
Description:
One of three cards for The Red Dragon Inn: 2016 SlugCrew Minor Reward. This card was given away if you have registered in SlugCrew and have done their events.

This drink brings you 3 alcohol content and an additional turn after the "Drink Me!" phase.

A second edition of this card is part of the The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox (all editions).

Name: Young Jacob Marley
Description:
Young Jacob Marley is a game of Victorian moneylending. You and your fellow clerks are newly enlisted in the service of the famous Jacob Marley. Your task is to earn the maximum profit by lending Marley's money to the citizens and businesses of London. You hope that by doing so, you might catch young Marley's eye and earn his undying friendship. You have a feeling this might come in handy one day...

Young Jacob Marley is a significant retooling of the classic game Jacob Marley, Esquire, which is also a game of cutthroat money lending in Victorian London. Imagine that.

Name: Lost My Mummy
Description:
Lost My Mummy is a two player, set collection game. You are racing your opponent to find your mummies by collecting information about them. This could be the canopic jar, the embalming material, the amulet, or even a death wish. This information is depicted on the cards and these are what you collect over the course of the game.

However, the main dynamic of the game are the dice. These are all bespoke dice that slow up an opponent or speed you up in your race to collect the cards that you need. They have low, medium or high numbers on them and this determines the range of choice that you have to select cards on your turn. Once found, you can then collect the reward for your found Mummy. The player with the most reward money, wins!

This family-friendly game plays at a number of levels, from simple enjoyable gameplay to more complex strategies to win! Over time, players develop a better understanding about how to find their mummies in the quickest time.

The artwork is very detailed and allows for children to really explore the area of Egyptian mummification. They are actively learning about a period of history, without actually realising the information is going in! This is the power of this little card game.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Hair of the Dwarf
Description:
This card came was the participation promo of The Red Dragon Inn Organised Play Season 2 (2016).

Hair of the Dwarf brings 2 alcohol contents and then lose 1 fortitude or discard 2 hand cards. Furthermore, it can't be splitted by any card.

The Organized Play Kits each contained 40 copies of this card (20 for each tournament) and 6 copies of Whitehawkâ€™s Private Reserve (3 for each tournament).

A second edition of this card is part of the The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox (Collector's Edition).

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Whitehawk's Private Reserve
Description:
This card is the premium promo of The Red Dragon Inn Organised Play Season 2 (2016).

It brings 2 alcohol contents to the user and 1 alcohol content to other players.

The Organized Play Kits each contained 6 copies of this card (3 for each tournament) and 40 copies of Hair of the Dwarf (20 for each tournament).

A second edition of this card is part of the The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox (Collector's Edition).

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Nitrel Glycerin
Description:
This card was the participation promo of The Red Dragon Inn Organised Play Season 3 (2017).

It reduces 2 fortitude points and also discard 2 hand cards, then discard 2 drink cards at top of card user's "Drink Me!" Pile.

The Organized Play Kits each contained 40 copies of this card (20 for each tournament) and 6 of the Hellspawn Stout (3 for each tournament).

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Hellspawn Stout
Description:
This card was the premium promo of The Red Dragon Inn Organised Play Season 3 (2017); it also appears in The Red Dragon Inn: Allies â€“ Evil Pooky.

It makes a choose at the start: discard this card and then use the top card of the drink deck; reduce 3 fortitude points and take any card from character deck to hand card deck.

The Organized Play Kits each contained 6 copies of this card (3 for each tournament) and 40 of the Nitrel Glycerin (20 for each tournament).

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Blud Light
Description:
It was the promotional card in Gen Con over 2017 and 2018 convention season.

It discards a hand card, then reduces 1 fortitude. A vampire character player gains 1 alcohol content instead of this fortitude loss.

Name: Minty's Bootiful Football Game
Description:
The BIG Match in a Tiny Tin!

This is a 2-player card and dice game recreating the ï¬‚ow and pace of a football/soccer match between two teams (Red and Blue), and is easily playable within 15-20 mins. It was originally designed to fit inside a standard Alto Mint Tin.

Using two standard ten-sided dice (2d10), this cracking little game helps to recreate all the ï¬‚ow and jargon of a real football match, with substitutions, injuries, free kicks, corners, penalties, last-ditch saves, formation changes, players getting sent oï¬€ and own goals too!

Players compare team strengths in three outfield areas (Defence, Midfield, and Attack) to determine a basic modifier to the Target/Progress Roll and then roll the dice to try and move the ball between their outfield areas in an eï¬€ort to score goals.

Included are playable Bonus Action Cards for each team, Event Cards that are drawn every time a Progress Roll fails (allowing formation changes, introducing injuries, providing second chances, adding injury time and tactical changes, etc), and an Xtreme Event deck that allows for those extra special moments when things go amazingly good, or disastrously bad!

If you download and play this game, please do leave any comments/feedback about your experiences — several players have asked if I'm planning a larger, full-card version, with more options and events, varied time segments and tighter controls, and this is certainly something I might be taking a look at over the next few months... Others have asked if I'm planning any expansions with real football player and team names, and to be honest I'd encourage anyone who wants to do this to freely supply replacement team/player ratings if they prefer. Better yet, upload and share them here!

Thanks in advance for taking the time to download and try it!

If you get to play it, please do rate it and add a comment -- all feedback is appreciated.

Name: Roman Trader
Description:
As a Roman Trader, it's your job to ensure you have the best and most prestigious collection of goods available for purchase...

Roman Trader is a straight set-collecting card game with a couple of novel twists, not least of which is the fact that the goods you're trying to collect are 'open' to other players — they may know what goods you appear to be collecting, but they won't know if you're putting together a specialist collection of varied goods from a particular country/principality!

The ability to collect from the discard pile and effectively set the game going backwards is another twist, and there's also a selection of special cards available to buy that allow you to increase your Warehouse space (hand-size), Plunder goods from other players, Smuggle goods long thought lost into your warehouse, Increase your Market share of selected goods, or Invest in the collections of other players!

Name: Wine Collector
Description:
Wine Collector is a visually dynamic tile-laying game in which you must try and satisfy the whims and wants of a selection of fussy Wine Collectors by finding the relevant wine in your cellar (represented by bottle/label parts), and putting together the relevant wine bottle from your collection of tiles...

Limits on available Grape varieties, Flavours, and Nuances will ensure it's not an easy task. Do you push-your-luck and hold out for 'the whole caboodle', or cut your losses and deliver a sub-standard product...?  It's your call, but when the last Wine Collector has left the building, it's game over!

Each round, players take it in turns to either draw a card from one of three decks (either a new one from the top, or the last previously discarded tile) or can choose to satisfy a Wine Collector's demands and 'claim' the relevant Income from that Collector. Collectors will pay well if all their demands are satisfied, or not-so-much if you can only meet some of their expectations...

There are three tile decks:

Grapes are double-sided tiles with a particular grape or wine variety on each side. These are placed in front of players when they're drawn, but each player may only have a maximum of four  grapes/varieties in front of them at any one time, but may choose to draw additional Grape tiles and discard down if necessary to ensure they do not exceed this limit. Grape cards will need to be given up for each Wine Collector claimed.

Flavours are tiles that have two representative flavours on them, and they can be utilised one way or the other by rotating the tile through 180 degrees. These are kept in a player's hand until used to claim a Wine Collector.

Finally, Nuances are tiles that have three descriptors on them, and can be used to satisfy Collector demands either in part or whole, depending on how they are used and which descriptors are covered by other tiles when making a claim. These tiles are also kept in a player's hand until used.

A player's hand size is limited to just six tiles/cards in total (excl. Grapes/Varieties which are kept on the table in front of them), and you must juggle these as best you can to make a call on what tiles are worth holding onto, and which ones can be safely discarded...

—description from the publisher

Name: Het Sliep Uit Spel
Description: A children's deduction game in the Mastermind tradition.  The goal is to correctly guess the colour and type of three hidden fruits.  A player's guesses are limited by a hangman-like monkey puzzle.  Less accurate guesses use up more turns.

Name: Chopply
Description:
Chopply is a Mark 'Chopper' Read themed board game which uses the mechanics of a simplified version of Monopoly.
The game comes with an interactive DVD of Heath Franklin playing Chopper and is activated when landing on certain squares(functioning similar to Chance and Community Chest cards).
Like Monopoly the game is won when other players go bankrupt(which is significantly harder to achieve due to no house/hotel options). A 2 player game is most likely to take days to determine a winner.

—user summary

Name: Clock Solitaire
Description:
Clock Solitaire is a card game with a traditional deck of 52 cards. The game is called Clock Solitaire, because twelve piles of cards are arranged like a clock face around a 13th one in he middle. The object of the game is to complete all other four-of-a-kind before the four kings are completed.

The cards are dealt face down into 13 piles, twelve in a circle around the last one in the middle. The piles are numbered 1 to 12 as on a clock face with pile 13 in the middle.

The top card of the 13 pile is revealed. Play the card under the corresponding pile. Ace under the 1 pile, 2 under 2, and so on. Faces are played Jacks under 11, Queens under 12, and King under 13. Then reveal the top card of this pile and play it as described above. If there is no more the face down card on this pile continue with the next face down card in clockwise order.

The game is won, if all piles become face up piles of four-of-a-kind. The game is lost, if the fourth king is revealed before all other cards are played face up.

Name: Stellar Leap: Frontiers
Description:
The Universe of Stellar Leap is expanding to all new frontiers, with resource focused planets, diverse asteroids, challenging traits, and more! Stellar Leap: Frontiers brings in new Planets, Asteroids, Events, and Traits that you can add to the base game for all new experiences. Solar System Completion Bonuses are introduced and allow players to significantly change Solar Systems how they see fit.

—description from the publisher

Name: Balck Friday: The Tatsinskaya Raid, December 1942
Description:
Wait a minute. Don't we mean BLACK Friday?

Nope. It's "Balck Friday," as in German General Hermann Balck. In the winter of 1942, his crack 11th Panzer Division fought an amazing series of battles along the Chir River in response to the Soviet surprise attacks that surrounded Stalingrad. It has been called one of the finest divisional actions of all time.

Bottom line, a single Panzer division, fighting one day after another (frequently after overnight marches) pretty much destroyed an entire Soviet tank army. And more.

But it's a virtually unknown story, as the disaster of Stalingrad and Manstein's relief effort (our own Wintergewitter game) get all the headlines. It may be hard to imagine, but minus Balck's extraordinary fire-brigade work, Stalingrad would have been much, much worse!

On Christmas Day (a Friday), Balck and his units were called upon once again. They had to stop a Soviet probe deep behind the porous German lines, aimed at knocking out the airfield at Tatsinkaya, which was supporting the Stalingrad Pocket. ATO spotlights Balck's amazing efforts with a new, unpublished and complete game.

With 100 die cut counters, a full color 8.5" x 11" map and just 4 pages of rules, you'll be able to quickly explore this one remarkable exploit during a very "dark December" for the Axis.

—description from the publisher

Scale: ca. 0.667 miles/hex, 8 hours/turn (from Jay Murphy's video posted on BGG on 10Jan2025: https://boardgamegeek.com/video/532153/balck-friday-the-tatsinskaya-raid-december-1942/balck-friday-intro ).
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Skënderbeu
Description:
English:
In November 1443, George Kastrioti Skanderbeg, at the head of 300 warriors, abandons the Ottoman army during the Battle of Niš. This is the beginning of an epic quarter-century struggle for freedom, where the principalities of Albania become the shield of the old continent against the incursions of the Ottoman Empire.

Be a part of this historical, strategic board game. Relive this age whose greatness has echoed through the centuries. The age of Skanderbeg!

The focus of this board game is precisely this period in history, filled with the struggles of the empires, kingdoms, and principalities of that time to politically survive and thrive.

Command the economic and military forces of a country. Display your skills as a brilliant strategist by planning moves and conflicts in different territories. Take over castles via diplomacy or strength, which will ensure your victory against your rivals. Change the course of history in just a short time!

We’ve tried to faithfully portray the facts and historical characters of that period without influencing the balance of the game, but have also tried to allow enough freedom for different fun strategies.

It is our hope and aspiration as creators of the game to bring about a friendly atmosphere, because we believe that games serve to bond us with each other.

Shqip (Albanian):
NeÌˆ neÌˆntor teÌˆ vitit 1443, Gjergj Kastrioti SkeÌˆnderbeu neÌˆ krye teÌˆ 300 lufteÌˆtareÌˆve, e leÌˆ ushtrineÌˆ otomane neÌˆ meÌˆshireÌˆ teÌˆ fatit gjateÌˆ betejeÌˆs seÌˆ Nishit. Ky eÌˆshteÌˆ fillimi i njeÌˆ epopeje cÌ§erek shekullore ku principata e arbeÌˆrit i beÌˆhet mburojeÌˆ kontinentit teÌˆ vjeteÌˆr.

BeÌˆhuni pjeseÌˆ e keÌˆsaj loje historiko-strategjike, teÌˆ epokeÌˆs seÌˆ arteÌˆ, madheshtia e seÌˆ cileÌˆs jehoi ndeÌˆr shekuj. EpokeÌˆs seÌˆ SkeÌˆnderbeut!

Fokusi i keÌˆsaj loje strategjike eÌˆshteÌˆ pikeÌˆrisht kjo periudheÌˆ e historiseÌˆ, e mbushur me peÌˆrpjekjet e principateÌˆs seÌˆ arbeÌˆrit, perandoriseÌˆ Otomane, mbreteÌˆriseÌˆ seÌˆ HungariseÌˆ dhe republikeÌˆs seÌˆ Venecias peÌˆr teÌˆ mbijetuar dhe peÌˆrparuar politikisht.

Komando ekonomineÌˆ dhe forcat ushtarake teÌˆ njeÌˆ vendi. Shpalos vlerat e tua si njeÌˆ strateg i shkeÌˆlqyer duke planifikuar leÌˆvizjet dhe konfliktet neÌˆ territore teÌˆ ndryshme.

ZoteÌˆro me diplomaci ose me forceÌˆ keÌˆshtjella, qeÌˆ do teÌˆ sigurojneÌˆ fitoren kundeÌˆr rivaleÌˆve. Ndrysho kursin e historiseÌˆ neÌˆ njeÌˆ koheÌˆ teÌˆ shkurteÌˆr!

Name: Bratz: C.I.Y. Shoppe Merch Master Game
Description:
Express your Bratz spirit with the "C.I.Y. Shoppe Merch Master".  In this Super-Fab game, explore your inner-merchandising diva. Play 3 exciting mini-games: Charades, The Rathers and Trend Zone to collect everything you need to open up your C.I.Y. Shoppe.

—description from the publisher

In this roll-n-move game you collect items and money as you move your Bratz around the board, sometimes encountering mini-games that help you meet the requirements of your hidden goal.

—user summary

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Duc de Duras 1765 / Dauphin 1766
Description:
The Duc de Duras was a merchant ship which regularly sailed half way around the world on behalf of the French East India Company. Her design allowed her to be quickly transformed into a warship in case of necessity to support the navy. When the French East India Company dissolved, all its ships were “adopted” by the French Navy, including the Duc the Duras. Purchased by King Louis XVI of France in early 1779, her size and new armament made her the equivalent of a 50–gun 4th rate ship of the line.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French ex–merchant ship “Dauphin 1766 (1770)”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Bertin 1761 / Berryer 1759
Description:
The Bertin was an East Indiaman used for long–distance trading during the eighteenth century. She was later converted into a ship of the line, taking advantage of her design, already suitable for a warship. When, in 1770, she was commissioned into the French Marine Royale, under King Louis XVI, her armament was doubled – Bertin became a fourth rate with 56 guns and a crew of more than 300 men.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French ex–merchant ship “Berryer 1759(1770)”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Bonhomme Richard 1779 / Bonhomme Richard
Description:
Originally named “Duc de Duras”, this ship was loaned by the French Crown to the newborn American Continental Navy, to be placed under the command of John Paul Jones; she was renamed “Bonhomme Richard”, in honor of Benjamin Franklin. During her cruise against the British, in the Battle of Flamborough Head, the Bonhomme Richard met her destiny fighting gloriously against the British Frigate HMS Serapis. Even if his ship was seriously damaged, John Paul Jones won the battle, but in the end lost his ship, which sunk in the aftermath of the battle.

This ship pack can also be used to represent another version of the “Bonhomme Richard 1779” with an alternative, possible armament.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Hamadryad 1797 / HMS Mahonesa 1796
Description:
The HMS Hamadryad, before her capture, was named “Ninfa” — a 36–gun Spanish frigate built at Mahon, on the island of Minorca. After her capture, Ninfa was taken to Gibraltar where she was commissioned under Thomas Elphinstone as HMS Hamadryad. After capturing two privateers, her career as an English ship was a short one, as she sank whilst trying to shelter from a storm in Algiers Bay, on 25 December 1797.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Mahonesa class frigate “HMS Mahonesa 1796”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Diana 1792 / Proserpina 1797
Description:
The Diana was one of the six Mahonesas-class frigates built at the Mahón shipyard in Minorca, based on French and British construction techniques and improving upon them – She was the fastest ship of her class. It participated in the evacuation of the Spanish forces at the Siege of Roses during the French Revolutionary Wars. On 13 October 1796, she was captured after an action against HMS Terpsichore at the Strait of Gibraltar, nearby Cape Gata.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Mahonesa class frigate “Proserpina 1797”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Mahonesa 1789 / Ninfa 1795
Description:
The Santa Monica – aka Mahonesa – was the first of a series of 6 frigates of 34 guns, built in the Minorcan port of Mahón, and had as her first service the transport of troops of Mallorca. This ship performed various services along the Mediterranean sea, and took part to French Revolutionary Wars until she was captured by the HMS Terpsichore on October 13, 1796 on the Cape of Gata, after a fight of three hours with 21 dead crewmen.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Mahonesa class frigate “Ninfa 1795”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Africa 1781 / HMS Vigilant 1774
Description:
The Inflexible–class ships were designed for the Royal Navy by Sir Thomas Slade, based on his earlier design for the Albion class. These ships were armed with 26 24–Pounder guns in the gundeck, 26 18–Pounder guns in the upperdeck, 10 4–Pounder guns in the quarterdeck, and 2 9–Pounder guns in the forecastle.

HMS Africa participated to the last battle of the American War of Independence, at Cuddalore in 1783. She returned to England once news of the peace arrived and was present at the Battle of Trafalgar in 1805, engaging the combined Franco–Spanish fleet in battle. She later fought in the Baltic Sea during the Gunboat War and, under the command of Captain John Bastard, Africa was part of the War of 1812, failing to catch the USS Constitution.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Intrepid class “HMS Vigilant 1774”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Polyphemus 1782 / HMS America 1777
Description:
The Intrepid–class ships were designed for the Royal Navy by Sir John Williams. These ships were armed with 26 24–Pounder guns in the gundeck, 26 18–Pounder guns in the upperdeck, 10 4–Pounder guns in the quarterdeck, and 2 9–Pounder guns in the forecastle.

HMS Polyphemus was laid down at Sheerness in 1782 and commissioned in 1799 under the command of Captain G. Lumsdaine. She sailed in the North Sea Fleet on the Baltic Sea until 1802. In 1805, Capt. Robert Redmill commanded her in the Battle of Trafalgar, where she engaged the French ships Neptune and Achille and captured the Spanish ship Argonauta. She was later in service along the French coast and in the Americas.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Intrepid class ship of the line “HMS America 1777”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Agamemnon 1781 / HMS Raisonnable 1768
Description:
The Ardent class ships were designed for the Royal Navy by Sir Thomas Slade using as a reference the French ship Fougueux. These ships were armed with 26 24–Pounder guns in the lower deck, 26 18–Pounder guns in the upperdeck, 10 9–Pounder guns in the quarterdeck, 2 9–Pounder guns in the forecastle.

HMS Agamemnon sailed and fought in the American Revolutionary, French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars, taking part in the major naval battles of those conflicts. Lord Nelson served as captain on this ship during her service in the Mediterranean Sea. She was frequently in need of repair and refitting, but she fought at the Battle of Trafalgar forcing the surrender of the Spanish Santísima Trinidad. This ship ended her career in South America, wrecking on the shoal of Rio de la Plata.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Ardent class ship of the line “HMS Raisonnable 1768”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Malta 1800 / HMS Tonnant 1798
Description:
The Tonnant class ship HMS Malta previously served with the French Navy as the “Guillaume Tell”, until she was captured in the Mediterranean Sea by the British Navy during the blockade of Malta. As Guillaume Tell, she took part in the Battle of the Nile, becoming one of only two French ships to escape the destruction of the fleet, and took refuge at Malta, where was captured. After her capture, she sailed in the British Navy for 40 years, with missions in the Channel, the Atlantic and the Mediterranean.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Tonnant class ship of the line “HMS Tonnant 1798”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Neptune 1803 / Ville de Varsovie 1808
Description:
The Bucentaure class ship Neptune was launched at the beginning of the Napoleonic Wars. After missions on the West Indies, she was used against the British in Mediterranean Sea. During the Battle of Trafalgar she was engaged by Nelson himself, and she dueled with several British ships, surviving the battle. She later became part of the Spanish fleet, named Neptuno, after Spain declared war to France, and spent most of her life under the Spanish flag.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French Bucentaure class ship of the line “Ville de Varsovie 1808”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Bucentaure 1803 / Robuste 1806
Description:
Bucentaure was the lead ship of her class and was the flagship of Vice–Admiral Latouche Tréville, died on board on 18 August 1804. Vice–Admiral Villeneuve hoisted his flag on 6 November 1804 and on board he hosted the Franco–Spanish war council at Cadiz. At the Battle of Trafalgar she was commanded by Capt. Magendie and defeated by Admiral Nelson's HMS Victory, losing 197 men and with 85 wounded and after three hours of fighting, she surrendered to HMS Conqueror.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French Bucentaure class ship of the line “Robuste 1806”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Non-denominational Seasons Greetings Pack
Description:
Includes cards previously released in our 2012, 2013, and 2014 Holiday Packs, plus a bunch of new cards.

—description from the publisher

A Target exclusive holiday pack containing 12 new cards (2 prompt cards, 10 response cards) and 18 cards from previous holiday packs. Released 12/5/2017. Icon: a gift box with a bow.

Name: Pokémon TCG: Base Set 2 Expansion
Description:
Base Set 2 is an English-language expansion with no corresponding Japanese-language expansion; the cards brought the English-language game scale into rough parity with the Japanese-language game.

The expansion includes 130 cards.

—user summary

Name: Pokémon TCG: Gym Heroes Expansion
Description:
Gym Heroes is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion "Gym Booster 1: Leaders' Stadium".

The expansion includes 132 cards.

—user summary

Name: Pokémon TCG: Gym Challenge Expansion
Description:
Gym Challenge is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion "Gym Booster 2: Challenge from the Darkness".

The expansion includes 132 cards.

—user summary

Name: Happiness Board Game
Description:
Based on the latest scientific research from Positive Psychology, the Happiness Board Game teaches players how to raise their happiness levels. Players take turns rolling dice and moving around the game board. Game board is made up of three kinds of spaces: positive circumstances and attitudes, negative circumstances and attitudes, and bonuses.

When players land on a positive space they take a card from the corresponding deck and read it out loud. Cards present positive situations were points are rewarded for being in a positive circumstance or having a positive attitude. Those points are then multiplied by their corresponding weight (10% or 40% respectively) that the situation has on one’s happiness level. Players than move their score tracker the appropriate number of spaces in the scoring area.

The same happens when players land on a negative space, except the points are negative and suggestions are given on what players can do to raise their happiness levels in negative situations.

Some of the cards provide points of discussion such as, “You begin volunteering at the local animal shelter. Scientific studies have found that volunteering increases our level of happiness. Right now have every player name some volunteering work that he or she would like to do.”

Play ends with the first player to reach 100 points.

—description from the designer

Name: Pokémon TCG: Legendary Collection Expansion
Description:
Legendary Collection is an English-language expansion; there is no equivalent Japanese-language expansion.

The expansion includes 110 cards.

—user summary

Name: Digital Safety Game
Description:
Created by the Tallinn University Digital Safety Lab The idea of the game is to learn more about digital safety. The goal is to answer as many questions as possible and win after accumulating a required number of cards. The game is designed so the inquirer has to formulate a question and evaluate whether the answer is correct or not. Discussions and real life examples why this knowledge is important are encouraged.

At his/her turn, the player (inquirer) chooses and asks a question on the card from the next player (respondent). The inquirer evaluates whether the answer is correct or incorrect.
In case of CORRECT answer the respondent keeps the card and places it in front of him/her, face up.
In case of INCORRECT answer, the inquirer keeps the card and places it in front of him/her, face up.
Player who first collects 3 cards from one category (same color) shouts out "I'm Safe!" and wins the game!

—user summary

Name: Hit Me!
Description:
Hit me! is a comic book style push your luck card game. Players will be playing Hit! cards to make other players discard cards from their Life deck. The last player with cards remaining in their life deck is the winner.

Players begin with a small deck of face-down cards that make their life deck and a single Hit! deck in the middle of the table. During a player's turn, they draw a card from the Hit! deck and place it face up for all players to see. They continue to play cards until they choose to stop or they Bust and are out of the round.

If a player draws a Hit! card, they place it in front of any other player. If the current player stops before Busting, all other players will discard 1 card for each Hit! in front of them. All cards are added to a communal discard pile. If the Hit! deck runs out of cards. All of the cards in the discard pile are reshuffled to make a new Hit! deck. If a player draws a Trip! card, they place it in front of themselves. If a player ever draws 3 Trips! they Bust, and they instead discard 1 card from their life deck for each Hit! in front of all players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Legends of the Alliance
Description:
From the very first days of the Imperial Assault Core Set, players have been launched into the Star Wars galaxy, playing out the thrilling missions of the game’s narrative campaigns. These campaigns have continued through expansions like Twin Shadows, Return to Hoth, The Bespin Gambit, Jabba’s Realm, and Heart of the Empire. Though these campaigns took you to every corner of the Star Wars galaxy, there was still a common thread. In every campaign, up to four players took on the roles of Rebel heroes, battling a single Imperial player who commanded the forces of the Empire arrayed against you.

Now, with the Legends of the Alliance companion app, you have the chance to unite with all of your friends in a cooperative campaign. The Legends of the Alliance app takes over all of the functions once performed by the Imperial player, freeing you to experience entirely new campaigns in a fully cooperative environment with your friends as you fight side by side against the Galactic Empire!

Name: There Grew A Kingdom
Description:
There Grew A Kingdom is a medieval theme, middleweight strategy board game for 2 to 5 players, and one game takes about 20 minutes per player.

It is a competitive 4xGame that uses mechanics such as area control, worker placement and resource management.

It has soft end game trigger, player powers, and card combat system.

The goal of the game is to get the most Glory Points.
Those you get for several actions that reflect the glory of your Kingdom.

The game area is made up of hexagons, which are placed randomly.

By activating resource areas, you get resources which you are using to build and upgrade the cities, as well as your army.

The army is an important aspect of the game.
It is used to protect your kingdom and expose other players.
Army battles are carried out using army cards.

This game does not use any dice!
Consequently, the game has a very low luck factor!
Your game is determined by your decisions and the players' reaction to them.
The only luck element is an Army Card Battle that you can try to avoid.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pokémon TCG: EX Ruby & Sapphire Expansion
Description:
Pokémon TCG: EX Ruby & Sapphire was an English-language expansion  for the PokÃ©mon Trading Card Game roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Expansion Pack.

It was the first expansion of the EX series of expansions.  The EX series added Pokemon-ex to the game, which were Basic Pokemon that were more powerful than usual Basic Pokemon, but were worth two prize cards if Knocked Out.

It was also the first expansion Nintendo Co., Ltd. published after transferring the rights from Wizards of the Coast.

The expansion was related to the PokÃ©mon Ruby and Sapphire video game for the Game Boy Advance.  The e-Reader for the Game Boy Advance could read data from this expansion's cards.

The expansion included 109 cards.  There were 14 Rare Holo cards, 13 Rare cards, 34 Uncommon cards, 34 Common cards, 8 Rare Holo ex cards, and 6 Energy cards.

Pokémon TCG: EX Ruby & Sapphire was sold in 9 card Booster Packs, and 2 Theme Decks.

Booster Packs for EX Ruby & Sapphire Expansion (9 Randomized Cards Each):

     Lairon Booster Pack
     Manectric Booster Pack
     Mightyena Booster Pack
     Sceptile Booster Pack


Theme Decks for EX Ruby & Sapphire Expansion (60 Fixed Cards Each):

     Ruby Theme Deck
     Sapphire Theme Deck

Name: Get Packing!
Description:
In Get Packing! Gather up to 6 players, take a Packing Board and start filling it up with the appropriate items to go on your trip. But watch out, because opponents will try to steal your items using Wild Cards. First player to fill up their Packing Board gets a certificate for a JetBlue flight out of town, so Get Packing!

Get Packing! is  a game created by JetBlue sold on Amazon that includes a contest for a free flight(for a limited time when game is released).

Name: Pictureka: Mega Mat
Description:
The preschooler version of the classic Pi0ctureka game with a giant mat

Pictureka! is a new kind of game, both in mechanic as in artwork. The mechanic is invigorating with its large square gaming tiles. The game board is composed of 3 by 3 game tiles, so the game board on which is played is a huge square of 63 cm x 63 cm. This is large enough for several players to be able to play the game at the same time. The game board is “alive”, it is not a static board as the tiles are flipped over, turned and moved. So it is not possible to memory map the board. The mechanic of an ever changing board makes it not only fun; also the challenge is kept into the game all the time.

A game turn 
Players will have to throw a color dice at the beginning of their turn. According to the color thrown (3 possibilities) they must draw a mission card of the same color. There are 3 kinds of missions.

How to win the game? 
Be the first one to have successfully accomplished 10 missions. Each successful mission gives 1 point, so be the first one to get 10 points. 
The artwork is something not to be found in ‘standard’ games. The personal drawing style of the artist Eugene makes this a kind of playing artwork.
